<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When a loop exit edge is split, LCSSA form may require new PHIs in the new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exit block. This function inserts the new PHIs, as needed. Preds is a list</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of preds inside the loop, SplitBB is the new loop exit block, and DestBB is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the old loop exit, now the successor of SplitBB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa650642c90f81466c2cd062e00ab152b">createPHIsForSplitLoopExit</a>(ArrayRef&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; Preds,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">                                BasicBlock &#42;SplitBB, BasicBlock &#42;DestBB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If this edge is a critical edge, insert a new node to split the critical</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// edge. This will update the analyses passed in through the option struct.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This returns the new block if the edge was split, null otherwise.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If MergeIdenticalEdges in the options struct is true (not the default),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42;all&#42; edges from TI to the specified successor will be merged into the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">/// critical edge block. This is most commonly interesting with switch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions, which may have many edges to any one destination.  This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ensures that all edges to that dest go to one block instead of each going</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to a different block, but isn&#39;t the standard definition of a &quot;critical</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">/// edge&quot;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is invalid to call this function on a critical edge that starts at an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IndirectBrInst.  Splitting these edges will almost always create an invalid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">/// program because the address of the new block won&#39;t be the one that is jumped</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab61955a622d233750894890e0704da5c">SplitCriticalEdge</a>(Instruction &#42;TI, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SuccNum,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">                              </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CriticalEdgeSplittingOptions &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/core/lvoptions-cpp/#ab4088b7a11f3cbc38ac16a6e9c72494e">Options</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  CriticalEdgeSplittingOptions(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">                              </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Twine &amp;BBName = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If it is known that an edge is critical, SplitKnownCriticalEdge can be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">/// called directly, rather than calling SplitCriticalEdge first.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method introduces at least one new basic block into the function and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">/// moves some of the predecessors of BB to be predecessors of the new block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The new predecessors are indicated by the Preds array. The new block is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">/// given a suffix of &#39;Suffix&#39;. Returns new basic block to which predecessors</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from Preds are now pointing.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If BB is a landingpad block then additional basicblock might be introduced.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It will have Suffix+&quot;.split&#95;lp&quot;. See SplitLandingPadPredecessors for more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">/// details on this case.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This currently updates the LLVM IR, DominatorTree, LoopInfo, and LCCSA but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">/// no other analyses. In particular, it does not preserve LoopSimplify</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (because it&#39;s complicated to handle the case where one of the edges being</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">/// split is an exit of a loop with other exits).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">/// FIXME: deprecated, switch to the DomTreeUpdater-based one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9d391b6acc6d90c9b8a8442324b1aa6f">SplitBlockPredecessors</a>(BasicBlock &#42;BB, ArrayRef&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; Preds,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Suffix, DominatorTree &#42;DT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   LoopInfo &#42;LI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method introduces at least one new basic block into the function and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="comment">/// moves some of the predecessors of BB to be predecessors of the new block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The new predecessors are indicated by the Preds array. The new block is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">/// given a suffix of &#39;Suffix&#39;. Returns new basic block to which predecessors</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from Preds are now pointing.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If BB is a landingpad block then additional basicblock might be introduced.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">/// details on this case.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This currently updates the LLVM IR, DominatorTree, LoopInfo, and LCCSA but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="comment">/// no other analyses. In particular, it does not preserve LoopSimplify</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method transforms the landing pad, OrigBB, by introducing two new basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="comment">/// blocks into the function. One of those new basic blocks gets the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="comment">/// predecessors listed in Preds. The other basic block gets the remaining</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="comment">/// predecessors of OrigBB. The landingpad instruction OrigBB is clone into both</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of the new basic blocks. The new blocks are given the suffixes &#39;Suffix1&#39; and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#39;Suffix2&#39;, and are returned in the NewBBs vector.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This currently updates the LLVM IR, DominatorTree, LoopInfo, and LCCSA but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="comment">/// no other analyses. In particular, it does not preserve LoopSimplify</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (because it&#39;s complicated to handle the case where one of the edges being</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><Highlight kind="comment">/// split is an exit of a loop with other exits).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a949b0428c89b8ccf62d469bd325244ed">SplitLandingPadPredecessors</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Suffix2, SmallVectorImpl&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; &amp;NewBBs,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal">    DomTreeUpdater &#42;DTU = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, LoopInfo &#42;LI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method duplicates the specified return instruction into a predecessor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which ends in an unconditional branch. If the return instruction returns a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value defined by a PHI, propagate the right value into the return. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="comment">/// returns the new return instruction in the predecessor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal">ReturnInst &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2e4b18daaf5f20f1ade3a9f66b86d843">FoldReturnIntoUncondBranch</a>(ReturnInst &#42;RI, BasicBlock &#42;BB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       BasicBlock &#42;Pred,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       DomTreeUpdater &#42;DTU = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Split the containing block at the specified instruction - everything before</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SplitBefore stays in the old basic block, and the rest of the instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the BB are moved to a new block. The two blocks are connected by a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="comment">/// conditional branch (with value of Cmp being the condition).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Before:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Head</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="comment">///   SplitBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Tail</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="comment">/// After:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Head</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="comment">///   if (Cond)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="comment">///     ThenBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="comment">///   SplitBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Tail</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p ThenBlock is not specified, a new block will be created for it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p Unreachable is true, the newly created block will end with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="comment">/// UnreachableInst, otherwise it branches to Tail.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns the NewBasicBlock&#39;s terminator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Updates DTU and LI if given.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SplitBlockAndInsertIfThenElse is similar to SplitBlockAndInsertIfThen,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Before:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Head</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="comment">///   if (Cond)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="comment">///   else</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="comment">///     ElseBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><Highlight kind="comment">///   SplitBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Tail</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Split the containing block at the specified instruction - everything before</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SplitBefore stays in the old basic block, and the rest of the instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the BB are moved to a new block. The two blocks are connected by a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="comment">/// conditional branch (with value of Cmp being the condition).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Before:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Head</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="comment">///   SplitBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Tail</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="comment">/// After:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Head</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="comment">///   if (Cond)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="comment">///     TrueBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="comment">///   else</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="comment">////    FalseBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="comment">///   SplitBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Tail</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p ThenBlock is null, the resulting CFG won&#39;t contain the TrueBlock. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\p ThenBlock is non-null and points to non-null BasicBlock pointer, that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block will be inserted as the TrueBlock. Otherwise a new block will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="comment">/// created. Likewise for the \\p ElseBlock parameter.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p UnreachableThen or \\p UnreachableElse is true, the corresponding newly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="comment">/// created blocks will end with UnreachableInst, otherwise with branches to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Tail. The function will not modify existing basic blocks passed to it. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="comment">/// caller must ensure that Tail is reachable from Head.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns the newly created blocks in \\p ThenBlock and \\p ElseBlock.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Updates DTU and LI if given.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7ac00229d8c59902686f52ed061cdc80">SplitBlockAndInsertIfThenElse</a>(Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af71ef8ea795d6a6eb87a3499f3b0c90f">SplitBlockAndInsertForEachLane</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Check whether BB is the merge point of a if-region.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If so, return the branch instruction that determines which entry into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BB will be taken.  Also, return by references the block that will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><Highlight kind="comment">/// entered from if the condition is true, and the block that will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="comment">/// entered if the condition is false.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This does no checking to see if the true/false blocks have large or unsavory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions in them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="normal">BranchInst &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1a5751a2dd7306ff9a59eae6c1de8925">GetIfCondition</a>(BasicBlock &#42;BB, BasicBlock &#42;&amp;IfTrue,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="normal">                           BasicBlock &#42;&amp;IfFalse);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Split critical edges where the source of the edge is an indirectbr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction. This isn&#39;t always possible, but we can handle some easy cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is useful because MI is unable to split such critical edges,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which means it will not be able to sink instructions along those edges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is especially painful for indirect branches with many successors, where</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we end up having to prepare all outgoing values in the origin block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Our normal algorithm for splitting critical edges requires us to update</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the outgoing edges of the edge origin block, but for an indirectbr this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is hard, since it would require finding and updating the block addresses</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the indirect branch uses. But if a block only has a single indirectbr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predecessor, with the others being regular branches, we can do it in a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// different way.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Say we have A -&gt; D, B -&gt; D, I -&gt; D where only I -&gt; D is an indirectbr.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can split D into D0 and D1, where D0 contains only the PHIs from D,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and D1 is the D block body. We can then duplicate D0 as D0A and D0B, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// create the following structure:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A -&gt; D0A, B -&gt; D0A, I -&gt; D0B, D0A -&gt; D1, D0B -&gt; D1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If BPI and BFI aren&#39;t non-null, BPI/BFI will be updated accordingly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When &#96;IgnoreBlocksWithoutPHI&#96; is set to &#96;true&#96; critical edges leading to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block without phi-instructions will not be split.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a502009030bffff8a6992f4e4eb9380f5">SplitIndirectBrCriticalEdges</a>(Function &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IgnoreBlocksWithoutPHI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  BranchProbabilityInfo &#42;BPI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  BlockFrequencyInfo &#42;BFI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Utility function for inverting branch condition and for swapping its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// successors</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a70cdc32fcfc8ba3feaf026f4959e2c2a">InvertBranch</a>(BranchInst &#42;PBI, IRBuilderBase &amp;Builder);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check whether the function only has simple terminator:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// br/brcond/unreachable/ret</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// i.e. the edge to the &#96;%suspend&#96; BB. This edge is special in that it will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
